DAILY LIVE POULTRY MARKET REPORT
VOL. 1 NO. 15 NEW YORK, N.Y. FEBRUARY 18, 1943

The following wholesale prices reflect sales on the new york city live poultry TERMINAL BY COMMISSION MERCHANTS AND OTHER ORIGINAL RECEIVERS. TRADING PERIOD covered by this report is up at 12:30 P.M. Prices are for Grade "all unless otherwise SPECIFIED.

THIS INFORMATION IS bROADCAST DAILY WGY, SChenectady at 6:20 PM: WOR, New York CITY AT 6:30 A.M. AND MHCU, Ithaca at 12 NOON, THE FOLLOMNG DAY.

WHOLESALE SELLING PRICES (FREIGHT, TRUCK AND EXpRESS) FEBRUARY 18

NEW YORK: FREIGHT RECEIPTS LIGHT. DEmand WAS iN EXCESS of SUPPLIES, MARKET EXTREMELY FIRM, TRUCK AND EXPRESS RECEIPTS WERE LIGHTER THAN LAST THURSDAY'S SUPPLY. TRADING ACTIVE, AND ALL OFFERINGS OF FONLS, FRYERS AND ROASTERS SOLD READILY AT FULL ceiling level. Miscellaneous items were scarce and somewhat restricted. Market firm
 4 ROASTERS, 1 BROILER, 1 MIXED, $2 \frac{3}{4}$ FONLS PLUS 1 LOAD DUE. THERE WERE 4 CARS ON track at 2 P.M. plus 5 cars due later. There are 5 or 6 cars reported for tommorow.

PHILADELPHIA: POULTRY MARKET FIRM. LIGHT RECEIPTS CLEARED QUITE REAOILY. ALL CLASSES WERE IN DEMAND AND SUPPLIES WERE insUfFICIENT TO MEET FULL REQUIREMENTS.

BOSTON: NO PRICES QUOTED. POULTRY MARKET ON FOWL AND CHICKENS IN SAME POSITION AS yesterday. One small lot of foml bought at $27 \phi$, small lot of chickens at $32 \frac{1}{2} \phi$. SMALL LOT OF FRYERS at $29 \phi$. SUPplies not able to meet demands. Market firm on all poultry.

Washington: L!ve poultry market firm. Prices largely nominal. Classes all unchanged.
Baltimore: Live poultry receipts very light. Market firm. Broilers and fryers HEAVY 283. 2912-31. ROASTERS 4.5 LBS 33-34; 5ç«‹ Lbg AND UP 35-36. FOWL MEDIUMS AND
